comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: To learn in this forum you must read. Being an avid reader and a voluminous writer is an added quality. I find learnmeabitcoin.com very easy for anyone to read and understand. Acknowledge what you read about bitcoin; write them down. It'll help you memorize and understand the term for a long time.  Especially, when you follow and contribute to discussions.  Asking questions from what you've learnt would help you stay aloof or ahead of other newbies, who don't practice it. Also don't fail because other members failed; quitting to learn bitcoin. Keep on visiting the forum on your leisure time or day. The categories or boards in the forum should be a simple guide to you in the forum. Often, read the board that interests you. Don't hesitate to look up new bitcoin terms. It'll help you feel among, when discussing about crypto in the forum and beyond.  If you've got closed persons in your neighborhood, you can engage them in a bitcoin conversation. Talking to them about those basic bitcoin information is also a better strategy of fastening your growth here. As these students may ask reasonable questions in the discussion section, between you and them. Which may require that you find more answers here. The forum condones reasonable questions, and, the comments or thread should pass the plagiarism test of the forum. When in search of new bitcoin information, some good social media platforms like Twitter still have writers who post genuine thread on their profile to help educate people on bitcoin. The best other methods of learning bitcoin is through reading bitcoin books like mastering bitcoin. The book will give you upper hand in the tech behind bitcoin and how they all work in line to maintain the security of network. Good luck and welcome to the forum.

comments.author: BRINIRHA
comments.body: I can only welcome you by saying welcome to this forum. Because it looks like other users have provided what you need to read if you want to learn about bitcoin. And because you are on this forum, you don't need to hesitate to ask whatever you want to know about bitcoin. Even though all the information about Bitcoin has actually been widely discussed and posted on this forum. But I understand that new users sometimes prefer to ask directly. And sometimes learning through discussion and two-way interaction is easier to remember and learn. One thing that is certain is that please do your own research if you want to start investing in anything, including Bitcoin. And please read all the rules in this forum and be more active in this forum while still adhering to the rules which are clearly written on several boards in the top posts which have been deliberately pinned for new users to read.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Welcome aboard, Kioprince. So far, some helpful links have been sent to you, but I will also urge you to read Jameson Lopp Bitcoin Resources.  What this forum is greatly against is "Plagerism." If you want to create a topic that is not authored by you, always drop a link to the original content. Punishment for plagerism is banned, and I believe you don't want to face such a situation. Also, never use AI or chat gpt to create topics or make comments; endeavor to contribute organically. Create time and read all the reference articles and threads you have received on this topic, and you will surely gain good knowledge about Bitcoin and the forum.
